classes.lab1.math_operations package¶

Submodules¶

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations module¶

Math Operations Module

This module provides functions for basic mathematical operations.

These functions cover addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, exponentiation, square root, and remainder operations.

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_difference(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns their difference.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

Returns:

The difference between the two parameters.

Return type:

int

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_power(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns the first parameter raised to the power of the second parameter.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The base.

  • parameter2 (int) – The exponent.

Returns:

The result of raising the base to the power of the exponent.

Return type:

int

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_product(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns their product.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

Returns:

The product of the two parameters.

Return type:

int

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_quotient(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns their quotient.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

Returns:

The quotient of the two parameters.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ZeroDivisionError – If the second parameter is zero.

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_remainder(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns the remainder of dividing the first parameter by the second parameter.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The dividend.

  • parameter2 (int) – The divisor.

Returns:

The remainder of the division.

Return type:

int

Raises:

ZeroDivisionError – If the second parameter is zero.

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_square_root(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns the square root of each parameter.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

Returns:

A tuple containing the square root of each parameter.

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If either parameter is negative.

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.count_sum(parameter1, parameter2)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and returns their sum.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

Returns:

The sum of the two parameters.

Return type:

int

classes.lab1.math_operations.math_operations.make_calculations(parameter1, parameter2, operator)[source]¶

This function takes two parameters and an operator, and performs the corresponding mathematical operation.

Parameters:

  • parameter1 (int) – The first parameter.

  • parameter2 (int) – The second parameter.

  • operator (str) – The operator to perform the calculation.

Returns:

The result of the calculation.

Return type:

int or float

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during the calculation.
